intro: Haplopappus oppositifolius, commonly known as the narrowleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are opposite and linear, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in disturbed soils.
